alert.note: Alert for Henry; Rock Island (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 02 at 10:50AM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Illinois, including the following counties, Rock Island and Henry IL. * WHEN...Until 845 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...A suspected ice jam has resulted in some homes and other structures being impacted by high river levels along the Rock River in Rock Island county. Depending on ice behavior, any release of the suspected ice jam could result in sudden rises of water, leading to a rapid flooding situation. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1037 AM CST, The latest report from local law enforcement this morning reported ongoing high water in the area and minor flooding across the warned area, but river levels look to have receded 4 to 6 inches from where they were Sunday evening. An ice jam is occurring and may continue to cause a flooding threat, thus the warning will continue through this evening. However, if the river continues to recede, the warning may be cancelled or allowed to expire at 845 PM this evening. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Silvis and Coal Valley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
